job_title: Prospective Student Advisor in Bryan, TX
pros: Coworkers were great, love working with students
cons: Pay was terrible and upper administration only cares about money

pros:
The Bryan Campus is a great place to be-- it boasts 12,000+ students and classroom-focused faculty who go above and beyond their job descriptions to help students succeed. The Humanities Division has strong, home-grown leaders in key roles and collaborative faculty members. 

I would not recommend joining the Brenham Campus if you are a young professor looking for challenging, fulfilling work. The Bryan Campus, though a commuter campus, is high energy, as the majority of students are focused on getting into A&M ASAP.
cons: Administrative restructuring in the past 2 years has caused (or perhaps just exacerbated) deep rifts between many administrators and faculty members. The Brenham Campus vs. Bryan Campus divide can be a distractive nuisance, but hopefully the Board members and newly installed president will do the hard work necessary to distribute fair funds and acknowledgement across all campuses. There is much lip-service from top administrators, which can be extremely frustrating.

review_title: Blinn is a great school, this position is very taxing.
pros:
Easy workload
Free during the day for the most part
Spring break, Winter Break and summer off and paid
Essentially no supervision or micromanagement
cons:
On call 24/7
Work 7-midnight 7 days a week
low pay
Dealing with many disrespectful, "thug" wannabe kids
meetings early in the morning that last for hours after long nights of dealing with hooligan kids
job seems insignificant

job_title: Livestock Judging Coach in Brenham, TX
pros: Great place to work with great people! The smaller class size and caliber of students was outstanding.  Students were there to learn and gain knowledge prior to transferring to their 4 year institution of choice.
cons: Smaller town that has a relatively high cost of living in regards to either rent or land purchase.  The smaller atmosphere lends itself to everyone being involved in each activity.

pros:
Lots of holidays and leave time
Some flexibility in work hours
Congenial colleagues
Pleasant work environment, attractive campus
cons:
Some people get away with not doing their jobs
Pay rates are not up to date
No matter how hard you work, how exceptional your work product, and how grateful and appreciative your customers/clients . . . you will get no better than a 'good enough' at your annual employee evaluation. This is what HR wants.

pros: So much work to do, you are never bored.  Most people are very down to earth and nice to talk to.  Nice campus.
cons: Sooooo much work to do.  Too much for one person (and I am incredibly perfectionistic and an  extremely efficient worker who loathes incompletion).  I struggled to the point of near anxiety attack several times a week.

pros: It is a pleasant working environment where co-workers are friendly and helpful.  The give you everything you need to be successful.  There is great job security because of the exploding growth of the college.
cons: They are pretty stingy when it comes to reimbursement.  I never was reimbursed for my travel to come down and interview and there was no moving assistance for a 1200 mi. relocation.  Also, you must pay half of your families insurance premiums.

pros: Flexible with taking time off.
cons: If you're not a 3rd generation Brenhamite, you're an outsider.  Your suggestions for any improvements are not welcome.  Don't rock the boat, or make any waves; you will be black listed.  THE BATHROOMS ARE NEVER CLEAN.  THEY ARE DISGUSTING.

review_title: Easy laid back experience but not a lot of room for growth.
job_title: Learning Center Assistant in Bryan, TX
pros: It has a very laid back environment, with very friendly people. The work is not difficult, and time can fly by when you are there.
cons: It can be understaffed at times, adding to your individual assignments. At times it can also get a little dull making the day go extremely slow

pros: Friendly environment with a tight connection to the Texas A & M system giving a level of academic rigor not usually seen in a 2 yr college math department.
cons: The salary is on the low side for 2 yr colleges in the state of Texas and real raises are pretty much non existent.

pros: A select number of Blinn students displayed true academic discipline and a sincere striving for excellence.
cons:
A large number of Blinn students simply do not care.  Certain Blinn instructors in certain departments reinforce this apathy.  These instructors do not have expertise in their field, do not challenge students, and do not instill a passionate pursuit of knowledge.   Certain Blinn personnel are not rewarded for their commitment to higher education, but rather for their commitment to student opinion (by way of evaluation points), and their deference to Blinn status quo mediocrity.   The Bible states "To whom much has been given, much will be required."  In fact, at Blinn, the opposite is true.  "Little Known, Little Required" would be a far better motto for this institution.   A happy-go-lucky, oblivious instructor with limited love of learning who goes with the flow (not unlike a dead fish) is supremely valued at Blinn over a teacher who raises the bar and vigorously boosts students to their maximum potential.  Be advised that teachers who do not go the Blinn Way are not well received, and not well treated.  

While there, I strove to impart a passionate love of learning and intellectual discipline in a field both creative and technical.  In return, Blinn individuals sternly raised their voices towards me, tried to intimidate me, and shouted at me.  The entire experience was vicious and mean-spirited, which unfortunately is not atypical there.  One senior person (with negligible experience) even deliberately and forcefully thrust his hand towards my face.  This individual was not reprimanded, but rather, strongly supported and defended, and in fact received accolades and a promotion.   

Be careful with this place.  Avoid it if you can.   Be advised that this institution is full of the types of individuals who would gladly give Socrates the hemlock.

review_title: Excellent higher education location to get started
pros: Excellent environment to work. Fantastic coworkers. Everyone on campus is cordial, even if they do not know you.
cons: Sometimes, there are quite a few tasks to finish because departments are shorthanded. Many things to do, not enough people.

pros: Great job to get something down on your resume for future employment.
cons: You will never move up, never get a pay raise, and be treated poorly because the people who are there full-time only protect themselves and others like them because the school is struggling financially.  Students are numbers and are money.  It is not our job to get them out, it's our job to keep them as long as possible.
